channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: WNBA rookie Angel Reese makes double-double history
item.description: The "Double-Double Queen" is living up to her name early in her pro career. The Chicago Sky forward earned her seventh consecutive double-double in a win over Dallas — a league record for a rookie.
item.content:encoded:
The "Double-Double Queen" is living up to her name early in her pro career. The Chicago Sky forward earned her seventh consecutive double-double in a win over Dallas — a league record for a rookie.

(Image credit: Charles Rex Arbogast)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Philadelphia program aims to create affordable housing developers
item.description: People without access to capital are getting into housing development in Philadelphia. It's part of a program designed to create more affordable housing and boost non-traditional developers.
item.content:encoded: People without access to capital are getting into housing development in Philadelphia. It's part of a program designed to create more affordable housing and boost non-traditional developers.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Moselle

item.title: This police department's autism unit is saving lives
item.description: Montgomery County Police Department Officer Laurie Reyes speaks with NPR about the autism and dementia unit that is saving lives and helping families in Maryland.
item.content:encoded: Montgomery County Police Department Officer Laurie Reyes speaks with NPR about the autism and dementia unit that is saving lives and helping families in Maryland.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: Companies are using 'price pack architecture' to get consumers to buy more
item.description: There's a term companies are using more often recently: “price pack architecture.” It's meant to be a way to get customers to buy more, sometimes for more money per unit.
item.content:encoded: There's a term companies are using more often recently: “price pack architecture.” It's meant to be a way to get customers to buy more, sometimes for more money per unit.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Guo

item.title: Could Israel’s Iron Dome missile defense system hold up in a war with Hezbollah?
item.description: For over a decade, Israel has looked to the Iron Dome missile defense system to protect citizens from attack. But experts warn a war with Hezbollah could test it like never before.
item.content:encoded: For over a decade, Israel has looked to the Iron Dome missile defense system to protect citizens from attack. But experts warn a war with Hezbollah could test it like never before.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Hundreds of Muslim pilgrims died in heat-stricken Hajj
item.description: Collective prayers and struggles are core to Islam's Hajj, but heat took a toll this year: Hundreds died and thousands sought treatment for heat exhaustion.
item.content:encoded:
Collective prayers and struggles are core to Islam's Hajj, but heat took a toll this year: Hundreds died and thousands sought treatment for heat exhaustion.

(Image credit: Fadel Senna)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: 'Medicaid unwinding' can be dangerous for those who need opioid addiction medications
item.description: States overhauling Medicaid rolls have accidentally dropped eligible people from coverage, sometimes for months. That can be dangerous for those who need opioid addiction medications.
item.content:encoded: States overhauling Medicaid rolls have accidentally dropped eligible people from coverage, sometimes for months. That can be dangerous for those who need opioid addiction medications.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Colombini

item.title: NHL's Connor McDavid shines
item.description: The best player in hockey is having a record-breaking run in the postseason. Could a Stanley Cup be enough to make him a household name in the U.S.?
item.content:encoded: The best player in hockey is having a record-breaking run in the postseason. Could a Stanley Cup be enough to make him a household name in the U.S.?
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Judge dismisses charges in Nevada pro-Trump fake electors case over venue question
item.description: A judge has potentially killed the fake elector case in Nevada with a ruling that state prosecutors chose the wrong venue to file the case. The state attorney general says he will appeal.
item.content:encoded:
A judge has potentially killed the fake elector case in Nevada with a ruling that state prosecutors chose the wrong venue to file the case. The state attorney general says he will appeal.

(Image credit: L.E. Baskow)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The South is adapting to help keep kids safe as summer heat intensifies
item.description: Playing outside can now become dangerous as climate change fuels longer and more intense heat waves. Camps in Louisiana are making adjustments to deal with higher temperatures this summer.
item.content:encoded: Playing outside can now become dangerous as climate change fuels longer and more intense heat waves. Camps in Louisiana are making adjustments to deal with higher temperatures this summer.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins
